post.description:
Execute a workflow to create an image generation.

This endpoint:
1. Retrieves the workflow and specified version (or default version)
2. Applies prompt modifications (addition/deletion) to the user's prompt
3. Merges workflow config with user overrides
4. Creates a generation record using the workflow's model

Recommend workflows based on user instruction and additional info using LLM.

This endpoint uses an LLM to analyze the user's requirements and recommend
the most appropriate workflows. Falls back to random selection if LLM fails.

Args:
    instruction: User's description of what they want to create
    additional_info: Additional context (e.g., asset type, style, etc.)
    count: Number of recommendations to return (1-10, default 3)

Returns:
    A list of recommended workflows with their default versions

Upload a workflow sample image to Supabase storage.
Returns the public URL to be used in workflow sample_images array.

File restrictions:
- Image types only (png, jpg, jpeg, webp, gif)
- Max size: 10MB

post.description:
Extract asset information from file content using LLM

This endpoint takes text content and uses an LLM to extract structured asset information.
The LLM analyzes the content and returns a list of assets with their properties.

Batch create assets from ImageAssetCreateRequest objects

This endpoint takes a list of ImageAssetCreateRequest objects and creates them
as ImageAssets in the database.

Generate an optimized prompt for image asset creation using LLM

This endpoint takes asset information and generator specifications,
then uses an LLM to create an optimized generation prompt.

Generate an image using external API and return raw image bytes (quota enforced)

This is a standalone endpoint that generates an image and returns it directly
without storing it in the asset system.

post.description:
Manually create RunPod (hybrid mode)
Triggers pod creation and returns immediately
Use GET /runpod/status to poll for readiness

Returns:
    Pod information including pod_id and status

schema.title: Response Create Runpod Api V1 Runpod Create Post

post.description:
Manually terminate RunPod (hybrid mode)
Terminates the current pod immediately and clears state

Returns:
    Success message

schema.title: Response Terminate Runpod Api V1 Runpod Terminate Post

get.description:
Get current pod status from RunPod API
Returns real-time pod information

Returns:
    Pod status including pod_id, pod_name, status, runtime info, idle_seconds

schema.title: Response Get Runpod Status Api V1 Runpod Status Get

get.description:
Get usage summary statistics for a time period

Args:
    start_date: Start date (default: 30 days ago)
    end_date: End date (default: now)

Get paginated list of usage logs

Args:
    limit: Maximum number of logs to return (max 200)
    offset: Number of logs to skip

schema.title: Response Get Usage Logs Api V1 Usage Logs Get

get.description:
Get detailed metrics for a specific pod

Args:

Get usage patterns by hour of day
Useful for identifying peak hours

Args:
    days: Number of days to analyze (default: 7)

Get efficiency report showing best and worst performing pods

Args:
    limit: Number of pods to show in each category

generation_config.title: Generation Config
generation_config.description: Provider-specific generation parameters. Common: remove_background (bool, default: false), aspect_ratio (str). Azure OpenAI: quality ('medium'|'high'). A1111: negative_prompt (str), steps (int), cfg_scale (float), sampler_name (str). Gemini/Imagen: image_size ('1K'|'2K'|'4K'), aspect_ratio (e.g., '16:9', '1:1').
